description: Alteration of kalsomine, after Latin calcis, genitive of calx (“lime”).

entries.meaning: A form of whitewash (inexpensive white paint) made from calcium carbonate, glue and water, used to coat wooden or plaster surfaces.

verbs.description: calcimine (third-person singular simple present calcimines, present participle calcimining, simple past and past participle calcimined)
